item.source: ~How Do I Add the Grim Reaper's Hood?~

item.title: ~How Do I Add the Grim Reaper's Hood?~
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:31, topic:154048”]tell me about the reaper hood,
and i’ll give you rep++ for good…

hehehehe…[/quote]

Ok, On topic lawl.

I told you, Add this script into client.java


	if (command.startsWith("unpc")) {
		isNpc = false;
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

	if (command.startsWith("pnpc")) {
		try {
			int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));
			if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) {
				npcId = newNPC;
				isNpc = true;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
					} else {
						sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); }
							} catch(Exception e) {
								sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

And you will be able to type , ::pnpc [grim reeper ID] and you will turn into the grim reeper.

And sorry, Idk about the hood.

Read full topic
item.source: ~How Do I Add the Grim Reaper's Hood?~

item.title: ~How Do I Add the Grim Reaper's Hood?~
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

[quote=“X-J-K-X, post:1, topic:154058”][quote author=dd link=topic=210450.msg1843179#msg1843179 date=1193324908]
Its poetry, rap is for white kids who want to “bust someone up”.
[/quote]

Coming from you. LOL[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 04:10:38 AM[/size][hr][quote author=dog eats dog link=topic=210450.msg1843184#msg1843184 date=1193325020]
Ok the Pnpc trick, Open up Client.Java and under an already made command, Type:


	if (command.startsWith("unpc")) {
		isNpc = false;
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

	if (command.startsWith("pnpc")) {
		try {
			int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));
			if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) {
				npcId = newNPC;
				isNpc = true;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
					} else {
						sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); }
							} catch(Exception e) {
								sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

Thats the pnpc Command, What it does is that it changes you into the selected NPC you want, In this case, You want Grim reaper, So the command in this case would be:

::pnpc (grim reepers ID)

No, I can’t be bothered to find you the ID now, Lawl.
[/quote]

Lmao dude, have you read his question?. . :S[/quote]

[quote=“dog eats dog, post:18, topic:154048”][quote author=x0 0wn link=topic=210450.msg1843160#msg1843160 date=1193324499]
Me. I want to reach 1k posts with 10 rep.
[/quote]
What if i rep you? Lawl. <-- Of Topic

On Topic

Well i might not no how to properly add the item, But i no how you can turn into the grim reeper, If your interested.[/quote]

[quote=“X F U R Y X, post:20, topic:154048”]Lol im just jking, okay, get back to topic please…

uhh sure, how?[/quote]

Now jk, You was saying, :)[br][size=1]Posted on: October 25, 2007, 04:13:42 AM[/size][hr][quote=“dd, post:29, topic:154048”][quote author=dog eats dog link=topic=210450.msg1843191#msg1843191 date=1193325105]

What if i just go die,
BTW, Im not ready to fly

Death is such a wonderful thing,

It makes you want to dance and sing.

But i have to much bling,
and the chicks calling me, Phone goes ring…,ring…,ring

ooooo 0WN3D, Lawl.
[/quote]

Its turning into rap.

I don’t like this crap.

OOoOoO0O0o0Oo xD[/quote]

Maybe ill bust a cap,
when you sat in the chair,
when you was thinking about this rap
cause this rap is fat
why don’t you go back
to watching tv chap

Cause i can do this shit all night,
i can give you a fright
cause im in the mood for a rap
so don’t be a hater and say this is crap

00000 0WN3D

Read full topic

item.title: ~How Do I Add the Grim Reaper's Hood?~
item.dc:creator: @dog_eats_dog dog eats dog
item.description:
@dog_eats_dog wrote:

Ok the Pnpc trick, Open up Client.Java and under an already made command, Type:


	if (command.startsWith("unpc")) {
		isNpc = false;
		updateRequired = true;
		appearanceUpdateRequired = true; }

	if (command.startsWith("pnpc")) {
		try {
			int newNPC = Integer.parseInt(command.substring(5));
			if (newNPC <= 10000 && newNPC >= 0) {
				npcId = newNPC;
				isNpc = true;
				updateRequired = true;
				appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
					} else {
						sendMessage("No such P-NPC."); }
							} catch(Exception e) {
								sendMessage("Wrong Syntax! Use as ::pnpc #"); } }

Thats the pnpc Command, What it does is that it changes you into the selected NPC you want, In this case, You want Grim reaper, So the command in this case would be:

::pnpc (grim reepers ID)

No, I can’t be bothered to find you the ID now, Lawl.
